intro: Peschiera cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and border plantings.
